intro: Corydalis conorhiza, commonly known as the pink corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The plant produces vibrant pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Corydalis conorhiza is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
